title: Projects
Contact
About Me
text:
I’m Karan, a Data Science master’s student based in Bristol. I like building things that are practical, structured, and actually useful. Whether it’s a small automation script or a full project with documentation and a clean workflow, I care about clarity and making sure the end result feels intentional rather than thrown together.


Most of my work revolves around Python, R, SQL, and tools like Git, Docker, and Quarto. I enjoy taking something messy — files, data, or a vague idea — and turning it into something organised, predictable, and easy to understand. I’m not trying to overcomplicate things; I prefer solutions that are simple, reliable, and easy for someone else to pick up.


How I approach projects


I like to work in a step-by-step, structured way:



Start with a clear, honest description of the problem.


Break it into small, testable pieces instead of one big jump.


Keep the folder structure and code layout clean from the start.


Document decisions so future me (or someone else) can follow the logic.



I’m not trying to pretend everything is perfect or finished. I’d rather show real work in progress, explain what I’ve learned, and keep improving it over time.


Tools I use



Python


R & RStudio


SQL & MySQL


Docker


Git & GitHub


Quarto


Pandas & Data Analysis


Machine Learning



Outside of code


Outside of studying and building projects, I enjoy volleyball, exploring Bristol, and constantly refining my own setups—whether that’s my home tech, my workflows, or how I organise information. I like finding small improvements that make everyday things smoother.


Connect with me

title: Karan Homayounfar
text:
I’m a Data Science master’s student at UWE Bristol, focused on building efficient, real‑world solutions in analytics, automation, and applied machine learning.


I like taking messy, unstructured problems and turning them into clean, reliable systems. My work is driven by clarity, reproducibility, and the idea that good tools should make life easier, not more complicated.


View Projects More About Me Contact







Featured Projects




Python File Organizer


A practical automation tool that cleans and structures messy folders. It moves files into organised directories based on type and rules, making it easier to keep a machine tidy over time. The focus is on clarity and predictable behaviour.


Repo: github.com/knhf/file-organizer




This Portfolio


A Quarto-based personal site where I document my work and experiments. I treat the site itself as a project: structure, styling, and content are all things I iterate on, just like code.


Repo: github.com/knhf/KNHF.github.io




Finance / Quant Experiments


A set of small experiments with financial data, signals, and simple models. The goal is to understand behaviour, test ideas, and build intuition without overcomplicating things.




Tools I use



Python


Pandas & Data Analysis


Machine Learning (scikit-learn)


R & RStudio


SQL & MySQL


Docker


Git & GitHub


Quarto



What I’m doing now


Right now I’m focusing on building a small set of solid, well-structured projects rather than chasing dozens of half-finished ideas. I’m refining this portfolio, improving my automation tools, and exploring data in areas like finance and practical analytics. As I go, I’m trying to keep everything reproducible, documented, and honest about where it is in its lifecycle.
